Definition: In this task, you are given a review of the movie. Your task is to classify given movie review into two categories: 1) positive, and 2) negative based on its content.

Positive Examples.input: if you sometimes like to go to the movies to have fun , wasabi is a good place to start .
Positive Examples.explanation: The author in the review recommends starting with wasabi, which has a positive sense. So, the given review is positive.

Positive Examples.input: this is a film well worth seeing , talking and singing heads and all .
Positive Examples.explanation: The review states the film as worth seeing, talking and singing. So, the given review is positive.

Positive Examples.input: the movie quickly drags on becoming boring and predictable . i tried to read the time on my watch .
Positive Examples.explanation: In the review, it is mentioned that the film is boring and predictable which is a negative sense. So, the given review is negative.
The author in the review states the movie as a bloddy mess, which has a negative sense. So, the given review is negative.

Negative Examples.explanation: The author mentions that the movie is an unsatisfying thriller, which has a negative sense. So, the given review should be negative instead of positive.

Negative Examples.input: the film often achieves a mesmerizing poetry .
Negative Examples.explanation: The author mentions that the movie achieves a mesmerizing poetry, which has a positive sense. So, the given review should be positive instead of negative.

Instances.input: this warm and gentle romantic comedy has enough interesting characters to fill several movies , and its ample charms should win over the most hard-hearted cynics .
ahhhh . . . revenge is sweet !
this masterfully calibrated psychological thriller thrives on its taut performances and creepy atmosphere even if the screenplay falls somewhat short .
an exhilarating serving of movie fluff .
[fessenden] is much more into ambiguity and creating mood than he is for on screen thrills
its spirit of iconoclastic abandon -- however canned -- makes for unexpectedly giddy viewing .
hardly a masterpiece , but it introduces viewers to a good charitable enterprise and some interesting real people .
what it lacks in substance it makes up for in heart .

the fascination comes in the power of the huston performance , which seems so larger than life and yet so fragile , and in the way the ivan character accepts the news of his illness so quickly but still finds himself unable to react .

an overly melodramatic but somewhat insightful french coming-of-age film . . .

meticulously uncovers a trail of outrageous force and craven concealment .
there is a fabric of complex ideas here , and feelings that profoundly deepen them .

a provocative movie about loss , anger , greed , jealousy , sickness and love .

a lovely film for the holiday season .

you won't have any trouble getting kids to eat up these veggies .
a quietly reflective and melancholy new zealand film about an eventful summer in a 13-year-old girl's life .

simultaneously heartbreakingly beautiful and exquisitely sad .
remarkably accessible and affecting .
a fun ride .
kudos to the most enchanting film of the year .
